website_summaries.verdict: A solid laptop pack with well-appointed pockets and storage ideal for 15" laptops.
pros: Dedicated tablet or e-reader pocket.Tough construction
Fits under most airline seats even when fully packed

customer_reviews.title: My 17" Laptop will not fit
customer_reviews.text: This is a one of the nicest laptop backpacks I have seen. Unfortunately my 17" laptop will not fit and I had to return this. The dimensions of my laptop are 16.5 x 10.75 x 1.25. When the laptop is placed in the backpack it will stick out about 2" too far and the zippers will not zip. One review that I read said that he used a knife to cut off the bottom of the padding and was able to get their 17" device to fit. The specifications for the pack say that it is 19.5" lengthwise however the rounded ends cut the maximum device length to 14.5".
customer_reviews.author: MikeObermeyer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Open the box this bad boy came in and was in love! Exactly what I wanted and it looked SO GOOD!!!! Super high quality material and great design. Then, I tried to put it on. I am 6'2" abd about 260 with really wide shoulders and I looked like a clown with this thing on. The shoulder straps are WAY to short for big guy. Boxed it back up and returned it. Super bummed as it looked really nice (currently using a Tumi Alpha so I understand quality). I ended up ordering an Ogio Gambit which is supposed to have longer straps. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: Super Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality, a lot of padding
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality, a lot of padding, and a bunch of pockets for organization...it's exactly what I wanted. The padding does make it a little bulky, but, again, I wanted the padding. My last Dakine backpack started to deteriorate from the bottom/inside and I needed a replacement for work/travel/riding on my motorcycle...this Ogio Renegade RSS has been amazing. On top of all that it looks damn good too; so much so, my wife got jealous and bought herself an Ogio backpack too.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Laptop storage flawed
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I love it, I didn't need a backpack for the laptop compartment but knew it could be usefull. I read a review that mentioned the zipper won't zip without kind of scratching the corner of the laptop and just assumed it was a crybaby reviewer (no offense) but he/she was absolutely right. I used it with my Asus ROG laptop for the first time over the weekend and I could either not zip it up or risk scratching the corners of my expensive laptop. So now I just have a cool backpack with a useless laptop storage that I know I'll never use unless I get a 13" laptop..
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great as long as you don't care about the physical appearance of your laptop.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly-built backpack with good storage and great organization abilities. However, the laptop compartment is awful. I have a year-and-a-half-old Sager that I have kept pristine. It looks like it did today it came out of the box. Or, it did until I started using this backpack. My laptop now has scuffs all over the top and impressions in the screen from the keys. simply put, if you don't care about the physical condition of your laptop, this bag is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tuite

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement, Ogio customer for life after a second amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, I replaced my other Ogio bag with it and have been extremely satisfied. It's a bit pricey, but the quality is second to none. It's also very stylish. Lot's of storage space. and the specified compartments work fantastic for their designed purposes. The shock absorbing laptop portion is amazing as well dropped my bag twice by accident and it protected my expensive laptop, so yeah... Only negative thing is that I would have like a few more pen slots, but hey.
customer_reviews.author: Nanaki

customer_reviews.title: Durability? No problem.
customer_reviews.text: First off, this whole thing is coated in cushions and layers of fabric. It's hard finding slim fabric anywhere on the whole pack. I've had it over two entire years traveling 60% of the time for work and it still looks the same as the day I got it. The zippers are incredibly beefys with no intentions of snags or fails (also buttery smooth). I use this bad boy on a daily basis. Not only is it The perfect amount of pockets, but they are integrated into the pack so nicely that you can fill them almost endlessly. I swear this thing will probably outlive me and I'll hand it down to my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Zach A.

customer_reviews.title: Pockets galore!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back pack for my 15” MacBook Pro. I wanted something high quality to protect my investment. This backpack hasn’t failed me yet. The inside of the laptop compartment is a hard shell. I will say that I didn’t give it a full 5 stars because the bottom corners of where the laptop slips down, is starting to fray and show some wear. I haven’t had the back pack for 6 months. We will see how it holds up. I would say buy the darn thing. It’s a good looking backpack too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes! That's all. Yes..
customer_reviews.text: I searched high an low for a bag, you'll have to personally contact me to go threw the explanation of what I think, an how much research I did. But let me say this, I do not give high stars often if at all! Period. I believe, as far as compartments, materials which is the must important, yes. That snug take anywhere fit yes. Safety as it pertains to laptop, yes it floats. If it tears up, I will deduct an revise my review, in a heart beat. An I'm a person that is always out doors, for my business, will see.
customer_reviews.author: S.M.Simmons

customer_reviews.title: The laptop compartment makes this unusable
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and quality of these backpacks but the laptop compartment makes it unusable. It’s super tight (so thicker laptops don’t fit) and very rigid so the backpack falls over every time you set it down. Its so annoying. After trying it I quickly returned it and bought a Gambit model. Way better. If you really care about your laptop and have a super thin model and don’t care if you backpack can be put done without rolling then this may be for you. Otherwise stay away
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and holds all my stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have a large laptop (17" that is 1" thick). It doesn't fit in most bags that advertise they hold 17" laptops, but this one holds my laptop with room to spare. I also like the separate compartment for the laptop. Makes international travel much easier when having to take the laptop out for security. My only grip is that it unzips the whole way so that it will lay flat. But the fact that it unzips flat helps out in other scenarios, so not really a gripe, just something I have to get used to. Love all the pockets. Just discovered 2 more that I didn't know where there. Pockets everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for college students!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is amazing. I’ve never been one to spend more than 30 bucks on a backpack, but being a college student, I’ve gone through my fair share of backpacks. This backpack is super comfy. It has pockets for anything you want to put inside. I began using this backpack at the beginning of Spring semester here in 2019. I can definitely tell the difference in quality between this backpack and the multiple backpacks that I’ve had before. Will update periodically with durability and other things that occur.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Pese

customer_reviews.title: The Bag Exceeded My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bag fanatic always on a mission to find the perfect balance between function and style. This bag doesn’t compromise on either. I bought the black style which fits with casual dress for work. There’s plenty of room for essentials. I carry a Surface Pro, two spiral notebooks, power supplies, reader, action camera and haven’t begun to fill this bag up. Very well built but I think the carry handle will eventually be the weak point. The rivets weren’t centered on each side of the handle and the handle seems wrapped in a lightweight cloth. Only time will tell if this is the case, but regardless I am giving this bag 5 stars. It’s that good!
customer_reviews.author: RockPoppy

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and protective backpack
customer_reviews.text: Another solid Ogio product. I travel internationally and use my Ogio Sled for my luggage and this backpack is just as solid. Ample amount of space and yes it is limited on the size of the laptop you can pack, but I use a 14 inch tough book which is perfect size. Very tough protection pockets and balance of the overall build. My last backpack by Swiss started unraveling after 2 overseas trips. I will stay with Ogio for the consistent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Dupre

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bag, sub-pockets/organization, comfortable, stylish!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a self-described Bag snob. For work I sometimes need to lug around 2 heavy laptops. I previously purchased a $200 backpack my coworkers raved about, I returned it after 2 weeks. This bag is my favorite! Comfortable, plenty of sub-pockets, sits upright on floor, looks stylish yet semi professional, hard case for my sunglasses ... Nothing I don't love! (well, i do wish it had a sleeve to slide over my luggage handle when traveling but i think the newer model included this). All around a GREAT investment (and i'm quite picky).
customer_reviews.author: OrangeBlue

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again but I'll never have to.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has ample storage and love all the pockets. I call this backpack my mobile office. It protects my Razer Blade Stealth laptop with lots of room to spare if you have a larger laptop. I keep notebooks and textbooks in the middle pocket. I can fit a lunch box in the front larger pocket. On the sides I use the water bottle holder and I keep my laptop charger, phone charger, and note cards in their own safe pockets. The sunglasses pocket is very sturdy and keeps sunglasses very safe. It is very well made and it feels very good on my shoulders. I am always amazed when I put all my stuff in it and it fits.
customer_reviews.author: Shirelindy

customer_reviews.title: I like the pack a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the pack a lot. Plenty of zipper pockets, large and small.Material is of a heavy grade, and seems to hold up in heavy use at this time. Has a computer spot that is well cushioned and protected.The only fault I have noticed is the pack will not stay standing in the upright position, and you think it will sit upright, and come back to get your pack and its laying down. Small dislike to me anyhow, but all the others are worth the dollars.
customer_reviews.author: firedude

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is simply awesome. Laptop stays in a tight compartment so it does not "dance" inside the bag. There are several pockets which are great to store different things. Another good point is that things remains distributed from top to bottom and left to right. I had a Samsonite befere where things were all at the bottom; bag was fat/big at the bottom and slim at the top - hard to fit in an airplane, for example. I recommend this Ogio bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Ricardo Ferreira dos Reis

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack with some limitations
customer_reviews.text: Well made and sturdy with padded pockets to protect electronics or other delicate items. Side pockets are too small to carry a full size water bottle without it falling out. Who tested this? Laptop compartment is very stiff, which I suppose is good for protection, but despite the rather large size and weight of the backpack it is a little small for many of today’s larger laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: This pack has lots of zippered compartments, including a laptop cradle that provides good protection for my 14-inch Lenovo ThinkPad. The shoulder straps, and other surfaces that contact your body, are very well padded; they distribute the load very comfortably. However, I think the sternum strap is too small, and is not very effective. I just might cut it off.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack
customer_reviews.text: Officially have to carry a laptop everyday for work now and this backpack actually protects the laptop really well. Has pleanty of pockets to store everyday things and comfortable to carry. On the down side, im getting a lot of stiching started to come apart around the handle and straps. The clip that goes across the chest fell off days after receiving the backpack but didn't mind it much.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from my previous OGIO backup
customer_reviews.text: 3 years ago I had received a free OGIO backpack from an IT conference. It has held up incredible well. I carry a backpack daily, for work, travel and life. I overpack my backpacks which adds extra weight and wear. I spilled a drink inside of my old backpack which prompted me to find a new one, I ran across this one and while expensive was a nice upgrade! It has more pockets and better protection of my laptop than the previous one. I carry a 15" macbook pro and it fits nicely. LOTS of pockets and storage!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Noon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved loved my backpacks! I’ve had so many over the years! I’m very particular about what I use and I gotta tell you this is the best backpack I’ve ever had! It’s a great look and very classy! Great pockets and the protective area for the laptop is awesome!! If you’re looking for a good backpack than get this one! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good bag made better for frequent travelers
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for business. 100+ flights a year. Mostly domestic. I am hard on bags. This Ogio is my favorite ever. Virtually indestructible. The right mix of pockets and spaces to be organized without losing things. This version added a luggage pass through strap to attach to roller bag and that us great. Zippers dont catch. Seems dont pop. My only gripe is the shoulder straps - the padding compresses after a few weeks of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Solomon T, Grundy

customer_reviews.title: A lot of advertising but bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of advertising but bad quality. Before purchasing I saw several video and text reviews of Renegade RSS. Everybody said it is good and quality is very nice. This is not true. Just normal backpack. Lets say between normal and poor. Nothing special. Materials used are not bad but stitched wryly. Zipper of notebook compartment on right side always jams. Bottom of this compartment is not straight. Construction of main strap and upper handle looks weak. Main straps very short. I found only 1 benefit - this backpack has a lot of pockets. Maybe Amazon sell fake product? For that kind of quality price has to be 40-50USD. Not 100-150. Anyway for 100usd backpack you can find better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Straps are super short.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag but the straps are so short, like so short I must have got a lemon. I can barely get the bag on with the straps fully extended. Even my very petite wife had to strain to get both straps on. Wrote Ogio, they didn’t seem to give a crap or look into have. Have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Janice P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit. My second OGIO pack but the first one I purchased new. It's a tank, super happy with all of the pockets and the hard protective sections. Was able to fit a 15" MBP with an extra thin second monitor in the main sleeve no problem. All the cords and plenty more fit easily into the main pocket, and still had 2 other sections for everything else I need to take with me. When I start traveling again, I would imagine a change of clothes will fit in the main (big) pocket just in case luggage is lost and there's still room for everything I need to take for work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water bottle pockets insuffiecient
customer_reviews.text: I just recently purchased these backpacks as a solution to have my kids use a backpack for multiple years. I thought this would be the one, it is very rugged but the water bottle pouches are not deep enough. My kids put a 24-ounce water bottle in the pouch and one kid has already lost their water bottle because it fell out of the pouch. The zippers in the pouch tend to slide down after I cinch them up to secure the water bottle. Otherwise the Renegade is a fine backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Discriminating Consumer

customer_reviews.title: A new Renegade for me, and a hand-me-down for my son.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Renegade RSS in 2012. Last fall, I handed it down to my son and started using another bag for a while. I missed my Renegade so much that I purchased another one. The new (to me) Dark Static design looks amazing and the quality and service I received with my original Renegade seem to both be intact. I look forward to another seven or more years of service from this great bag.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gwathney

customer_reviews.title: Even more durable then I thought!!!
customer_reviews.text: When this came i knew i was gonna get something nice from a well respected brand but when I got it I realized it is even better than i thought. The zippers are all very sturdy, the tech vault is very hard, and the laptop shock proof compartment is very very hard and rugged and I know nothing is going to happen to my computer! I am more than happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Anil Kalmoni

customer_reviews.title: Great pack! Well made, roomy, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Even with two laptops, and a bunch of random objects in the (numerous) pockets, this pack is well balanced and comfortable. Unlike cheaper bags, this bag is made using a very good grade of cordura. The pockets are logically organized, and the pack has a professional appearance which is work appropriate. The sunglass pocket (protective) is also a plus. This is a great pack, and I wouldn't hesitate to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: 24 Track

customer_reviews.title: Worked well. No lower back aches
customer_reviews.text: The pack is worth the money. Just finished a work trip to india and china. No issues with the pack. It replaced a 18 year old swiss army pack which was hurting my back when fully packed. The new one. Once packed with gear was heavy. Never hurt my lower back. Love it. Plenty of pockets and my laptop fit fine. Straps never tore. And it fit fine under plane seats. I flew several airlines these past two weeks with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer tom

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, recommend
customer_reviews.text: Replacing my old O’gio backpack. Lasted 15 years of daily use and a minor motorcycle accident. Great products but a little pricey. Zippers on this bag do not look as heavy duty as my last one but sturdy. The pouches and pockets are all very useful. Only thing lacking in my opinion is a convenient hook on the outside to clip a keychain, otherwise great bag.
customer_reviews.author: dirtymofo

customer_reviews.title: The one and only you'll ever need!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, this backpack has been through tough times traveling across the US and all over the place. I work in IT as a systems engineer. Bought it early 2016. I LOVE it!. No signs of wear or tear. Plenty of pockets and compartments. LOVE the laptop cushion thing since I'm known for just dropping the backpack on the floor. Ogio, you really hit it with this one. Absolutely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Rick O.

customer_reviews.title: Great travelling backpack
customer_reviews.text: Been using this pack as my default travelling pack. Holds my 15" laptop, 10" tablet, my Nintendo Switch in a separate case, and my digital camera DSLR in a separate camera bag. The only problem is, when its full, I can barely fit it underneath the seat on the airplane and half to put it in the overhead bin, which makes it hard to take things in and out of it. But its still a great backpack.
customer_reviews.author: GeEkStEr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. (2 weeks in)
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of storage and very well put together. The zippers feel exceptionally well made and the backpack is extremely comfortable even when it is stuffed to the gills.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit 15" laptop
customer_reviews.text: My 15" Dell Precision laptop will not fit within the laptop compartment of this backpack, and allow me to zipper it closed. This same laptop fits perfectly within my OGIO Gambit backpack, so I was a little shocked that it would not fit in the Renegade, even though the product description states it could fit 15" and some 17" laptops. I'm sure if I had a 13" laptop it would fit fine. It doesn't have all of the pockets and features of the lesser priced Gambit, but otherwise it is a great backpack.
customer_reviews.author: smcc

customer_reviews.title: if laptops are your thing
customer_reviews.text: if you've got an expensive laptop this backpack is perfect for you. the suspension system takes up a lot of room so i returned it for the version that doesn't have the suspension and I love it. However, if your ok with the capacity sacrifice, the suspension system in this pack seem great.
customer_reviews.author: UNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: Fine for small and thin laptops
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, this bag as a lot of storage space and compartments. However, it is very wide. So you may have issues placing it under the seat in front of you on some aircraft. It seems well made. However, the single laptop compartment is very small. I have a laptop that is Mac-Air sized, and it fits fine. However, if your laptop is much thicker or heaven forbid like a gaming notebook, I can't see how on earth it would fit. They really need to re-design the laptop compartment to be more accommodating, given how large this bag is.
customer_reviews.author: DS785

customer_reviews.title: Best I've had
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, lots of space. The "armored" laptop slot is a brilliant design. My coworkers are now getting them but I insist they get different colors. The only downside is the padding against my back. I am somewhat thin and there could be some softer pads added to the backpack at contact points.
customer_reviews.author: Stupor Dave

customer_reviews.title: Laptop compartment is so tight!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the bag but very disappointed with the laptop compartment. I have never seen anything so tight or small for the laptop. Can squeeze anything else in there besides the laptop. I'm now shopping for a new laptop bag because this one is not serving the purpose and I've only used this once or twice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed in this bag and really wish I could have returned it. I purchased this bag based on reviews and the quality construction of OGIO. It's heavy without anything in it and even heavier when packed. I bought this bag to carry my laptop and personal items back and forth to work and just stopped using it because of the weight and strain on my back. It doesn't even hold by small yeti water bottle on the side. I was really expecting more from this bag for the expensive price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for teenager or student. Not commuter.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is definitely made for smaller framed people. 6'2" and 300 lbs made it difficult to slide this pack on and off. Looks cool and has lots of pockets....small pockets. Enough to say, "Which damn pocket are my keys in!!??" Great for a laptop and some headphone for travel. Not a daily commuter bag....and no room for a lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Werksman

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag wants to fall forward on its face every time you set it down. It won't stand up. It's very stuff opening the computer storage area. Like opening an alligators mouth every time. The handle is in the way of the protective storage area. Too hard to place anything in it. The other storage areas are way too small. I should have never invested my money in this bag. I'm very disappointed with OGIO. What a brand killer to their past products.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing backpack. I previously had an Underarmour backpack and ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing backpack. I previously had an Underarmour backpack and while the underarmour backpack was large and could fit a lot of thing in it, it was not as organized as this backpack. All the different pockets allow for great organization. It also has great support, it doesn’t feel as heavy as my old backpack with the same amount of things in it. The only small downside is the laptop compartment is a little small for my 15.6 inch laptop. It still fits but I have to pull the zippers a bit up so the laptop fits.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: otherwise i highly recommend this product and wish i could continue to use ...
customer_reviews.text: OK this backpack is stylish, durable, and suitable for safely carrying ones precious laptop and other small electronics...HOWEVER do NOT be mislead by the fact that it says "stores most 17" laptops." this fact is false. i ordered it for my thin model MSI laptop and the rounded corners of the compartment miss by over 3 inches. the product description is misleading and on the tags of the bag i received it says that the laptop compartment is only 15.5" in depth. do not get this unless you have a laptop 15" or less. and no i don't think 15.5" would fit. otherwise i highly recommend this product and wish i could continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Waites4

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Backpack! Super roomy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Backpack! Super roomy. I'm working on my degree in network administration So I carry a lot of tools, flash drives, etc. and this bag works great! The only complaint I have is that my laptop just barely fits.... I have a 15.6 inch laptop but it has a large bezel, probably at 17 inch with the bezel, so it cuts it close but overall I am satisfied with it!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Gidcumb

customer_reviews.title: You will love the utility
customer_reviews.text: I use it for travel. Almost has too many compartments if that's possible. Very accessible pockets. Water bottle holder and sun glass holder awesome. Computer slot almost too tight. My husband's I paid with bulky cover just fits. more sleek Surface fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from my Last OGIO
customer_reviews.text: I like that the computer compartment is a tighter fit - makes the whole bag a bit more durable it feels like. I had another model for about 4 years and it was starting to wear out a little - I loved it but this one is even a little nicer - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very solid backpack, but the laptop padding is almost TOO thick
customer_reviews.text: This is a really, really nice backpack. My only complaint is that the laptop padding is so thick it takes up a significant portion of the bag making it hard to fit anything else in there. If you're a student I might look for a backpack that can better accommodate books and notebooks, but for professionals just lugging around a laptop this is great.
customer_reviews.author: jacksoar

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! Bought this sucker to carry my SLR camera and tour books while traveling. It’s got great pockets and the sides are perfect for carrying a water bottle. The fabric is rugged and looks good as well. If you’re looking for a travel bag Or gig bag look no further. I searched high and low, sent several BP backS back while looking for the perfect bag.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is by far THE best pack I have ever owned or used. Room for more than you can carry, including laptop and tablet (in separate, protected compartments) and zippered pockets and compartments all over the bag. Plus it is very comfortable, so much so I switched from a briefcase to this for traveling. Great, heavy-duty material and zippers. Perfect for business or leisure.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Well it can carry a lot of gear. It is extreamly well built. It doesn't pull your shirt backs up like many other backpacks. So worth the cost. I have in it the following. 1 15.6" laptop 1 17.3" laptop 1 ipad 1 transformer TF101 Asus Nexus 7 I have chargers for each device Plus flashlight Emergency hygiene kit pens, pencils a corded and a cordless mouse Oakley M frame sunglasses 2 tactical knives Some other odds and ends. It handles the weight extremely well. One strap slips a little but I do think I have it over loaded. Every aspect of this backpack is made for a Techno Warrior.
customer_reviews.author: Cpttango30

customer_reviews.title: Straps are to short for XL people
customer_reviews.text: Awsome bag, great compartments, and nice padding for the laptop... HOWEVER, the straps are to short and little. I'm 6'3 250+ and the straps ar full extension are probably about half the length of other bags I've tried. I found myself having to "pretzel" myself into the straps to put the bag on my back. Though it was comfortable once I got it on (via padding on back and straps) I prefer the option of being able to adjust the bag between sitting lower or higher on my back. With that said I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bag holds stuff, lots of stuff, and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone thru many bags in my quest for the best bag for me for travel. The last 7 weeks, i have traveled 6 of the 7. Lots of airports, lots of TSA, lots of pushing, pulling, tugging, cramming stuff in. It holds, it helps me keep organized, and will hold a lot of stuff. I travel with a laptop, 2 external portable monitors, lots of cables, tablet, many other things, and it holds it without issue, and nothing gets damaged. Prior bags include 2 swiss bags (not bad bags, just like this one more), an Ebag (limited space), another generic,. This is the hands down winner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpack I have used
customer_reviews.text: I travel a fair amount and have been through many different types of bags. This is the best by far. Pockets work perfect for me and computer storage is great. It is protective to the computer and not really that hard to get it out. Love the strap that keeps it on my roller bag. The other thing I love is the sun glass holder on top. In AZ I need glasses every day and this protects them and keeps me from losing them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Regehr

customer_reviews.title: great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I got it because of the color. the color is great. but I also love all the compartments. and it feels great on my back. I use it for conventions and when I go to Disney and six flags (places like that). I got a friend to buy it also lol. I think its well worth it. and I have put so much in it and the load felt balanced.
customer_reviews.author: YourCuteTexan

customer_reviews.title: Very well built backpack
customer_reviews.text: This bag for the price seems a like a lot, and it is. However, there are so many pockets and it the durability of this backpack along with the aesthetics and build quality is well worth the money. The only complaint I have is the laptop slot/pocket can’t fit a 17inch or 16inch laptop. Other than that I’m really satisfied with this purchase. One more thing is no matter how you place the backpack unless it’s up against something it will fall over because of the weight. Overall 8.7/10
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This bag was heavy when I pulled it out of the box. Then I filled it with all my items for work, and it just was too heavy & uncomfortable to carry around with all the walking I do during a work day. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently and this is my goto bag if I'm doing a 2 or 3 day jaunt. plenty of storage space and fits under the seat in front of you with no issues. Laptop, tablet, papers, pens, pencils, glasses, 2 to 3 days of clothes, it is the only luggage I have when I'm only gone for a few days!
customer_reviews.author: David Downs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack!! I love how the pockets are set up and organized, the compartments for specific gear, sunglasses, etc. The laptop sleeve is AWESOME! The backpack is incredibly comfortable even when loaded down. I was working in the field and ran across a fellow technician who had also purchased the same backpack and on Amazon. Both of us were commenting on how much we really love this backpack. If you are considering purchasing this bag, go for it! It does NOT disappoint!!
customer_reviews.author: coon78

customer_reviews.title: The best, heavy duty laptop backpack you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty back pack that holds and protects my 15" laptop, school books, chargers, snacks, and other items. My only complaint is that the same materials used in making this backpack a veritable brick shit house, also make it heavier than most packs, so be ready to do some hefting.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you have a 17 inch laptop.
customer_reviews.text: The laptop sleeve is simply too small for a 17 inch laptop. The most it can reasonably hold is a 15 inch laptop. I wound up removing the incredibly annoying hard plastic liner from the laptop sleeve and putting binders in it instead. My laptop had to go in the next pocket, which actually appears to be significantly larger than the one that was meant to hold the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: High quality, wide mouthed pack that lacks colour options.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about reviews, especially from other Ogio packs, about fraying, etc. However, I've not encountered any of those problems. This thing opens up wide, like a hippo receiving food! The hardshell "pocket" up top, front and center, has been a godsend for me--hygiene products, glasses, etc. are safe here. My only complaint is with the lack of colour options--I HATE, HATE, HATE the standard black / red gaming colour combo!
customer_reviews.author: Psymon Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend another Ogio without it since it makes the backpack ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this on construction sites on an almost daily basis for the past 20 months stuffed with sharp tools and its held up. It also keeps the laptop I use for work safe. If you don’t need the laptop compartment, I’d recommend another Ogio without it since it makes the backpack a lot bigger. But if you need a heavy duty backpack that keeps a laptop safe, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality backpack. But it did not fit for ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality backpack. But it did not fit for me for a few reasons: - Laptop compartment takes too much space. It's too thick, as for me and takes backpack space. Also, my 15 inch HP barely fits there. - Straps indeed are too loose. I had to tighten them once in every several minutes. - I needed a universal backpack for my home-office travels and also my periodical longer trips (business trips, vacations etc). As for me, there is no enough space for longer travels. - Back is too firm. It does not take a shape of your back, but instead, you have to adjust to the backpack's shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, lots of small pockets like everyone else has said, but I haven't found much use for them yet (except to keep my keys). I use it for work with a 15" Lenovo Thinkpad, protects the laptop very well. Two things I didn't realise how much I liked having in my old Samsonite that are missing in this bag: there is no KEY HOOK, and no partitions for binders, notepads or files in the main compartment, it's just a big hole. Straps are short and do not stay adjusted, which turns out to be an annoyance and a blessing at the same time because I need them at full extension to get the bag off my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: GranReviewsmo GTX

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it unless strictly for carrying your laptop or iPad
customer_reviews.text: Bag Is very well made but the main compartment has a lot of the room taken up but the laptop sleeve and the tech pocket giving you very little X awkward room inside the main compartment , and the straps for the shoulders are very short .. I can barely get both arms through with a sweatshirt on .... great potential for a bag and great ideas .. poorly executed
customer_reviews.author: Barry everson

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack. A bit firm on the back because ...
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. A bit firm on the back because the laptop carrier is in the inside back was hoping for a bit looser feeling backpack but this will do. Its not too small or too big it seems just right. If your looking for tons of storage space this may not be the bag. Definatley a great backpack for work or traveling with some stuff and a laptop. Looks are awesome those. Compartments are pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: ron davis

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The quality is obvious- materials and construction. The storage design is good and space is more than adequate. I just got it so long term durability is yet to be in evidence. Guessing that will good.., I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bananarama

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Lots of Storage Space!
customer_reviews.text: There’s a pocket for everything. Reinforced hard-pocket for Sunglasses is awesome. Pocket for iphone on the shoulder strap is a complete waste — no modern cellphone will fit in it. Everything else is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Zack

customer_reviews.title: you don't get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: used this bag for college. never had more than 1-2 books in it plus laptop at a time. tore just like other customers claimed within a month. ridiculously terribly quality for the price. i will not purchase from this company ever again. it's really a bummer because the laptop compartment is great, you could literally drop your computer in there and it won't smack against the ground because of the design. so disappointed with this purchase, I dont even use the bag anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Phalange

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I've ever owned - just needs a key hook.
customer_reviews.text: 99.9% perfect backpack. The only downfall is that there is not a key hook, which is very surprising considering everything else. I travel 2-3 weeks out of every month, both flying and driving. This is by far the best pack I've ever owned. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Drew_P

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a more comfortable option from Ogio than the freebie bag I received from work.. this is it! Lots of storage, easy to organize and very comfortable. Added benefit it’s got the pass through sleeve that you can attach it to a suitcase handle!
customer_reviews.author: B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Ideal + Practical gift for a man!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this backpack as a gift for my boyfriend. He has an old version of the OGIO backpack that was literally torn everywhere. He refused to get any other brand or model of OGIO (he doesn't do well with change). After much research, I found this model and just purchased it based on all the reviews. He absolutely loves it. Totally forgot about his old backpack! He has a Macbook Pro, it fits in there comfortably along with a bunch of other random things. It would be safe to say that he practically lives out of his backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag so far...has a discreet and we'll protected laptop pouch, it's padded and comfortable to carry. Can fit a tablet nicely as well as noise cancelling headphones and a camera with lenses or even a second laptop. It's a little pricey but worth it to protect expensive gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Machio

customer_reviews.title: Love Ogio.  Disappointed in this backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I received this and it does NOT include a luggage pass through slot as advertised on the site.
customer_reviews.author: Reeactor

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a week.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack after my old Ogio one gave up after 10 years or so. I loved this backpack. I like the look, I like the padding, I like all of the storage options, etc, etc. The strap that holds the water bottle in broke in less than a week. For the price of the backpack it should be better made. I returned it, because Amazon has amazing return ease and purchased a Ogio Gambit backpack instead. Hoping it lasts longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed.  Well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Well designed. Laptop, power cord, and mouse all placed nicely. Never had a backpack as nice as this. On the expensive side, but worth every cent. You get what you pay for. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rhyno

customer_reviews.title: This pack is brilliant. Multiple pockets
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous about this pack because I have a MacBook Pro 17" from 2011. The reviews varied about whether or not it would fit. It fits perfectly. PERFECTLY. This pack is brilliant. Multiple pockets, both inside and out. Everything that I carry (too much) is more than accommodated. I have traveled with this pack as my only luggage, as my computer bag for an academic conference, and as an every day carry bag. Outstanding on all counts. Buy this bag. Repeat, buy this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo S.

customer_reviews.title: This bag can take a beating!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong with lots of pockets! Never used a back pack before this was recommended from a friend. he was right we use it everyday for work, I carry my laptop, hand tools plus everything else I need to run around the city. if you looking for a bag that holds up to the day to day stress and looks good this is the back pack for you!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Pedone

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to travel overseas and have the ability to carry everything important with me. Only issue I've run into is over packing because space is so abundant! You're most likely going to end up with 7 shirts, 4 pairs of pants, 3 hats and 2 pairs of shoes for a weekend trip to the beach just because you can.
customer_reviews.author: Alain M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these backpacks for years and time to replace it.... How disappointing the TWO zipper pulls broke less then 30 days after first use. Very disappointing the quality used to be good not anymore. I would not buy this bag or brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea L.

customer_reviews.title: I love how it seems to absorb the extra bulk when ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this bag for about a year and a half now and it's held up quite well. I use it as my daily work laptop bag. I love how it seems to absorb the extra bulk when it's stuffed with light jacket, gloves, and extra laptop and other tech gear -- without bulging out too much and giving that turtle look.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Abelaye

customer_reviews.title: Great pack
customer_reviews.text: My husband adores this birthday gift (which he picked out). It has tons of fun little zippers and pockets. Even one for sunglasses and a nice cup holder type pocket on the side. I bought the gray one, and its a nice look; the pattern gives is interest over a solid. The color details on the straps are pretty sweet. Tons of padding in the straps and internally for the laptop. Also, we bought a large. My hubby is 6'2", 200#, and other packs tend to give him a cute Dora the explorer backpack look (e.g. tiny).
customer_reviews.author: April D

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time searching. OGIO is what you need!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute must for any student/office professional out there. My current job demands a “work from anywhere” mentality. Laptop, tablet, wireless keyboards, etc. I even keep a multiple 1:100 scale blueprints on me most of the time. Normally this would be overwhelming to anyone. But this backup literally does all the work for you. Tons of storage, great device/material protection and ridiculously comfortable to tote around. I won’t own another brand after the OGIO.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Linton

customer_reviews.title: awesome bag
customer_reviews.text: this is a very good backpack for school or travel. it has an awesome spot in the back that holds it secure to the telescopic handle of a carry on or rolling suit case. the laptop pocket is somewhat suspended in the back compartment so your computer stays off of the ground when you set the bag down. There are a ton of pockets as well. love the bag
customer_reviews.author: dean weber

customer_reviews.title: This bag consolidated my gear into one bag, I didn't think it was possible.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag from tip to bottom. I am only one week in but it helped me consolidate 2 bags into this one and that is a big deal when I use camera and computer gear every single day for work. My one bags is a ready, set, go bag for real. Now I need to remember where I put everything and remember it. Thats on me. The maker of this stands by their warranties too. Oh yea, YOUR LAPTOP IS SAFE AS CAN BE! I have had a lot of babs and ordered plenty for my employee's and this is far and away the one I would pick again for my MBP. Piece of mind right there.
customer_reviews.author: CNote3030

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad back pack, just a few design flaws in my opinion...
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack with plenty of room, but the location of the glass case holder is not ideally located in relation to the handle above it. It makes it a little difficult to put the case or other stuff in and out of the storage compartment. The handle seems a little weak for the size of the back pack. I don’t use it in fear it will break. The side pocket for the water bottle/coffee thermos is a little undersized. I placed my thermos in it and it fell out and was dented after hitting the asphalt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this back pack, it has pockets for everything I carry when I travel. I also use one of the brands suitcases. Built well and designed by someone who travels. Its just great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Wayne Fenner

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome backpack. My 17" laptop and much
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome backpack. My 17" laptop and much, much more fits with no problem. It appears very durable and rides well. The reason I gave it only four stars is it advertised a "Luggage Pass Through" and it does not have it. I travel a great deal and only take carry-on. A Luggage Pass Through would be a major plus. However, that being said, I will keep this item because of the many other great features and try to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Lots of Pockets
customer_reviews.text: High quality backpack with tons of storage pockets. I use this haul my stuff to and from the office. This backpack is ideal for storing and organizing all of your gadgets, sunglasses, and snacks. The built-in hardshell sunglasses pocket is handy. Like others have said, the laptop compartment is pretty tight, but it does offer great protection. My only complaint is that I wish the send large pocket was bigger to accommodate books/binders and a lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: C French

customer_reviews.title: Great for staying organized while traveling.
customer_reviews.text: May be a little large and bulky for some, but for flying travel it’s great. Lots of pockets and organization dividers etc. I personally use the “gear vault” for my sunglasses, as it’s a hard, lined pocket. Works great. The luggage pass through is a back saver in airports and I found I barely carry it on my shoulders. If you’re looking for a well thought out computer travel bag this is a great option. Can’t speak for longevity as I’ve only travelled with it once, but seems sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Seems Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for about a week, seems to be well made, havent had any issues with it. Does seem like they are missing some pockets or pouches in some areas of the bigger pockets, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: MeInHS

customer_reviews.title: Great for airline travel.
customer_reviews.text: Great for airline travel. Protective pockets for a laptop and sunglasses are great. The flap to attach to rolling luggage is great too. Material feels durable and of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Denning

customer_reviews.title: Unparalleled Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this bag for close to a year now and it has become one of my favorite bags to travel with. It's a little on the larger side for daily commuting. Durable material, plenty of pockets/compartments and it feels good on my back and shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: pvq

customer_reviews.title: Great book bag that will hold everything you need for daily work, or for a long trip with all day comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack with LOTS of storage. I have fit 2 lap tops with power supplies, an intuous medium tablet, apple wireless keyboard, mouse, notebooks, coffee mug, and many other miscellaneous items in it with plenty of room to spare. It is comfortable to wear, even when loaded down with heavy items. I would recommend this book bag for anyone that has a lot to carry. The padding for the lap top pouch is awesome as well. The extra pouches seem well thought out and the overall storage is very useful. Also makes a great carry on bag for air travel.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Well done OGIO!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a backpack guy, I’ve spent more money on packs than I care to admit and I have to say this is one of my favorites of them all. Excellent zippers that move with smoothness, large pockets, great material and build. OGIO maybe my new favorite bag at half the price of most of my other top bags.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Seems fragile
customer_reviews.text: I still have an old backpack from Ogio Squadron 15 that i like it a lot, and bought this one pretending to be even better, but i didnt feel the same confidence i used to feel on the old backpack, feel that this Renegade one is to weak. The arm stripe is already broking. Feel sad for that, as i bought in USA and live in Brazil i cant send it back to amazon, and the backpack has no longer 1 year. Hope Ogio improve in the next flagship backpack
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: I was extremely happy with the Swiss Gear bag and used it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag to replace Swiss Gear bag. I was extremely happy with the Swiss Gear bag and used it to travel around the world, as well as, an everyday bag. However, I did not like the fact that the front pocket on the Swiss Gear would spill out if picked up when open. I bought the Ogio in hopes that it would be a little better, I was pleasantly surprised with how comfortable the bag is and the amount of space even though it feels a little smaller.
customer_reviews.author: EVK03

product_meta.title: OGIO Renegade RSS Backpack
product_meta.description:
Ogio is a leader in marketing and supplying the Powersports industry with performance gear comprised of bags, packs, ramps, stands and other accessories. OGIO’s focus on innovative products is paralleled with the finest quality construction using premium materials that have been rigorously tested against blowouts, abrasion, color fading.



 * Armor protected dedicated laptop compartment with RSS fits most 15” laptops and select thin 17" laptops
 * Integrated foam panels keep your electronics and other valuables protected
 * Padded iPad(TM)/tablet/e-reader pocket
 * Crush proof Tech Vault pocket with soft tricot liner
 * HUB (Hybrid Unibody Backpanel) for ultimate comfort
 * Padded mouse/digital camera pocket
 * Increased shoulder strap foam padding creates Sweet Spot comfort zone
 * Fully adjustable ergonomic shoulder straps with sternum strap
 * Two zippered side utility pockets
 * Dual side water bottle/accessory holders
 * Quick access expandable phone pocket
 * Deluxe organization panel with zippered stash pocket
 * Soft touch padded neoprene grab handle
 * Polyester
 * Dimensions: 19.5" H x 14" W x 10" D
 * Weight: 3.5 Lbs
 * Capacity: 1800 Cubic Inches
 * Laptop Pocket: 15.5"H x 10.5"W x 1"D
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
Armor protected dedicated laptop compartment with RSS fits most 15 Inch laptops
Integrated foam panels keep your electronics and other valuables protected
Crush resistant Tech Vault pocket with soft tricot liner
HUB (Hybrid Unibody Backpanel) for ultimate comfor

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
